new_signals.title: NVIDIA Vera Rubin Platform Launch - Next-Gen AI Supercomputer
new_signals.description: NVIDIA unveiled Vera Rubin at CES 2026, its next-generation AI chip platform featuring six new chips for AI supercomputing. First products arriving second half of 2026. Includes Gr00t vision language models for humanoid robots.

new_signals.title: Boston Dynamics-Google DeepMind Partnership for Gemini-Powered Atlas Robots
new_signals.description: Boston Dynamics partnered with Google DeepMind to integrate Gemini AI into Atlas humanoid robots. Strategic collaboration with Hyundai to accelerate next-generation humanoid development.
new_signals.source: CES 2026, Morocco World News, Hyundai Press

new_signals.title: Lyte Robotics Emerges from Stealth with $107M to Improve Robot Vision
new_signals.description: Former Apple Face ID engineers launched Lyte Robotics with $107M funding from Fidelity, Atreides Management, and others. Developing technology to help robots see better and move more safely.

new_signals.title: xAI Closes $20B Funding Round with NVIDIA Backing
new_signals.description: Elon Musk's xAI completed $20 billion funding round from investors including NVIDIA, Valor Equity Partners, and Qatar Investment Authority. Major AI infrastructure investment.

new_signals.title: IBM Declares 2026 as Year of Quantum Advantage
new_signals.description: IBM publicly stated 2026 will mark first time quantum computers outperform classical computers, achieving quantum advantage. AI and quantum systems beginning to operate as mutually reinforcing stack.

new_signals.title: Room-Temperature Quantum Computing Breakthrough - IonQ and Xanadu
new_signals.description: IonQ's trapped ion technology and Xanadu's photonic qubits could make room-temperature quantum computing a reality in 2026, eliminating need for extreme cooling.

new_signals.title: Complex-Valued Neural Networks for Quantum Dynamics Prediction
new_signals.description: New arXiv paper (2601.03964) introduces complex-valued neural networks for learning quantum dissipative dynamics, outperforming real-valued networks in convergence speed and physical fidelity.

new_signals.title: Molecular Devices with Dynamic Role-Switching Capability
new_signals.description: Scientists developed molecular devices that switch roles between memory, logic, and learning elements within same structure through precise chemical design allowing dynamic electron reorganization.

new_signals.title: CRISPR Breakthrough Activates Genes Without Cutting DNA
new_signals.description: New CRISPR technology can turn genes on without cutting DNA, representing major advance in gene editing safety and precision for therapeutic applications.

new_signals.title: CRISPR-GPT AI Co-Pilot Automates Gene Editing Workflows
new_signals.description: First agentic AI co-pilot for gene editing, CRISPR-GPT automates design, execution, and analysis of experiments, reducing experimental cycles from weeks to hours.

new_signals.title: FDA Approves First Therapy for TA-TMA (YARTEMLEA)
new_signals.description: Omeros' YARTEMLEA received FDA approval for hematopoietic stem cell transplant-associated thrombotic microangiopathy, first and only approved therapy for this fatal complication. Launch January 2026.

new_signals.title: Immune Cell Atlas Reveals East-West Differences
new_signals.description: Giant functional atlas of immune cells in Chinese cohort published in Nature reveals crucial differences with European and Japanese datasets, advancing personalized medicine.

new_signals.title: Quantum-Informed ML Framework for Sensing Materials
new_signals.description: arXiv paper introduces MORE-ML, computational framework integrating quantum-mechanical property data with ML to predict sensing-relevant properties in artificial materials.

new_signals.title: Artemis 2 Moon Mission Rollout January 17
new_signals.description: NASA rolling out rocket for Artemis 2 moon mission on January 17, launching no earlier than February 5. First lunar excursion with crew in over 50 years with 3 NASA + 1 Canadian astronaut.

new_signals.title: AI Upskilling Becomes Existential Priority for Organizations
new_signals.description: 89% say workforce needs improved AI skills but only 6% began meaningful upskilling. 80% of engineering workforce needs reskilling through 2027. Workers with AI skills command 56% wage premiums.

new_signals.title: Gen Z Comprises 27% of Workforce in 2026, Demands Flexibility
new_signals.description: Gen Z now 27% of workforce, will reach 30% by 2030. 72% most likely to leave jobs without flexible work policies. Half refuse jobs misaligned with social/environmental values.

new_signals.title: Generation Alpha Dominates Social Media with 64% Daily YouTube/TikTok Use
new_signals.description: 64% of US children aged 8-12 use YouTube or TikTok daily. Nearly two-thirds ages 8-10 spend up to 4 hours daily on social media. 38% create content rather than just consume.

new_signals.title: Generation Alpha's Economic Impact to Reach $5.46 Trillion by 2029
new_signals.description: Gen Alpha's direct and indirect economic impact projected at $5.46 trillion globally by 2029, driven by household influence and early brand loyalty.

new_signals.title: Five Generations Working Side-by-Side for First Time Ever
new_signals.description: For first time in history, five generations working together. Millennials and Gen Z will comprise 74% of global workforce by 2030. Multigenerational workforce management critical.

new_signals.title: Remote Work Tensions Escalate with 'Empowered Non-Compliers'
new_signals.description: 30% of organizations plan to reduce/eliminate remote work in 2026. High-value employees ignore office mandates. 70% prefer hybrid/remote, 85% say remote work is #1 job application factor.

new_signals.title: U.S. Labor Participation Rate to Dip to 60.4% by 2030
new_signals.description: U.S. labor participation rate projected to decline from 61.7% (2020) to 60.4% by 2030. Reflects aging population and demographic shifts impacting workforce availability.

new_signals.title: Japan's Fertility Rate Hits Historic Low of 1.15 in 2024
new_signals.description: Japan's total fertility rate dropped to 1.15 in 2024, lowest ever recorded. Median age 50.8 years. Only 758,631 babies born in 2023, lowest since 1899. Population projected at 87M by 2070.

new_signals.title: Europe Projected to Lose 7% Population by 2050
new_signals.description: Europe facing 7% population decrease 2022-2050. Fertility rates at record lows even in family-friendly Nordic countries (Finland: 1.25 in 2024). Two-thirds of global population below 2.1 replacement rate.

new_signals.title: Gen Z Intentional Living and Emotional Grounding Movement
new_signals.description: Major Gen Z theme for 2026: intentional living and emotional grounding. Gravitating toward slower, meaningful experiences providing emotional comfort and stability. Reaction to fast-paced digital culture.

new_signals.title: IMF Projects Global Growth at 3.0-3.1% for 2025-2026
new_signals.description: IMF upward revision to 3.0% (2025) and 3.1% (2026) global growth. OECD expects 2.9-3.1%. World Bank more cautious at 2.3% (2025) with tepid 2026-27 recovery due to trade barriers.

new_signals.title: G20 Inflation Expected to Fall from 3.4% to 2.9% in 2026
new_signals.description: OECD reports G20 headline inflation declining from 3.4% (2025) to 2.9% (2026). Core inflation in advanced G20 economies from 2.6% to 2.5%. Most approaching central bank targets.

new_signals.title: Goldman Sachs Forecasts 'Sturdy' 2.8% Global Growth in 2026
new_signals.description: Goldman Sachs Research projects sturdy global growth of 2.8% in 2026, balancing optimism with persistent uncertainties from trade tensions and geopolitical factors.

new_signals.title: Stablecoin Regulation Implementation Targeted for 2026
new_signals.description: Full stablecoin regulation implementation targeted 2026. GENIUS Act rollout accelerating bank/enterprise adoption. Regulators must finalize rules by July 18, 2026. Includes issuer licensing and rehypothecation prohibitions.

new_signals.title: CFTC 'Crypto Sprint' to Complete by August 2026
new_signals.description: CFTC under Trump administration wrapping up crypto sprint by August 2026. Focus on spot crypto trading, tokenized collateral, blockchain integration. Bitcoin and Ethereum primarily under CFTC as commodities.

new_signals.title: States Exploring Bitcoin Reserves and Tax Exemptions
new_signals.description: Texas, Arizona, New Hampshire exploring Bitcoin reserves and tax exemptions. Arizona proposals could reach voter approval November 2026. New Hampshire planning direct BTC treasury purchases.

new_signals.title: Job Disruption to Affect 22% of Jobs by 2030, Net Gain of 78M Roles
new_signals.description: By 2030, 22% of jobs disrupted: 170M new roles created, 92M displaced, yielding net gain of 78M positions. Workers with AI skills earn up to 56% more. 59% of global workforce needs training.

new_signals.title: U.S. Organizations Project 3.6% Mean Salary Increases for 2026
new_signals.description: U.S. organizations projecting 3.6% mean salary increase budgets for 2026, signaling cautious economic environment while attempting to retain talent amid tight labor market.

new_signals.title: Science's 2025 Breakthrough: Unstoppable Rise of Renewable Energy
new_signals.description: Science magazine names renewable energy growth as 2025 Breakthrough of Year. Renewables surpassed coal globally. Solar/wind covered entire global electricity use increase Jan-June 2025. Over 800 GW installed.

new_signals.title: Global Storage Installations to Exceed 100GW in 2026
new_signals.description: Annual global energy storage installations expected to exceed 100GW in 2026 for first time. Equipment prices now $117/kWh, less than one-third of three years ago. Critical for grid stability.

new_signals.title: EV Sales Over 25% of Global Car Sales, Forecasted 40% by 2030
new_signals.description: Electric vehicle sales now exceed quarter of global car sales, forecasted to rise to 40% by 2030. Driven by falling battery prices and better vehicle options. Battery costs enabling mass adoption.

new_signals.title: EU Battery Carbon Footprint Labeling Mandatory by August 2026
new_signals.description: Battery carbon footprint labeling becomes mandatory by August 18, 2026 for applicable batteries in EU. From 2027, Commission will set maximum carbon footprint limits. Major supply chain impact.

new_signals.title: China Expands Carbon Market, Plans Absolute Emissions Caps
new_signals.description: China expanding scope of carbon market and planning absolute emissions caps. Ramping up hydrogen efforts with new policies. Japan's GX-ETS carbon market launches 2026.

new_signals.title: Green Hydrogen Projects Coming Online in 2026
new_signals.description: Multiple green hydrogen projects launching 2026: Uniper Dutch project, Air Products NEOM Saudi Arabia complex, Uruguay Kahir처s plant. Singapore 600 MW hydrogen-ready powerplant first half 2026.

new_signals.title: 4.5 Terawatts of New Wind/Solar Expected Over Next Five Years
new_signals.description: Globally, 4.5 terawatts of new wind and solar installations expected over next five years, 67% increase over preceding five-year period. Installations to be flat in 2026, then grow modestly to 2030.

new_signals.title: Eurasia Group Names U.S. as Principal Source of Global Risk in 2026
new_signals.description: Eurasia Group identifies United States itself as principal source of global risk in 2026. Trump tariff policies, AI race with China, weakened global leadership cited as major concerns.

new_signals.title: Europe Facing 'Intensifying Pressure Campaign' from Trump Administration
new_signals.description: European Commission President's tariff deal stability described as 'pipe dream.' Europe likely facing intensifying pressure campaign from Trump in 2026. Baseline 10% tariff, protective and reciprocal tariffs announced.

new_signals.title: China's Critical Minerals Dominance Puts World on Notice
new_signals.description: China's near-total control over critical minerals and rare earth elements, with demonstrated willingness to weaponize dominance. Beijing restricting global access to minerals and processing technology.

new_signals.title: 62% of Investors Worry About AI-Driven Market Concentration Risk
new_signals.description: Institutional investors cite AI-driven disruption as biggest risk for 2026. 62% worry significant AI technological development could bring concentration risk to equity markets. AI race raises geopolitical stakes.

new_signals.title: Trump Administration Deploys Tariffs as Bargaining Leverage Tool
new_signals.description: Trade friction under Trump becoming more targeted and sector-specific. Deploying tariffs to drive bargaining leverage, reshape investment flows, punish or privilege countries. Geopolitical tensions driving tariff use.

new_signals.title: COP31 Climate Summit Scheduled November 9-20 in T체rkiye
new_signals.description: COP31 scheduled November 9-20, 2026 in Antalya, T체rkiye. Shared leadership model with Australia driving negotiations. Global Implementation Accelerator delivering report at COP31.

new_signals.title: WEF Global Cooperation Barometer Shows Multilateralism Weakening
new_signals.description: WEF Global Cooperation Barometer 2026 shows overall cooperation unchanged but composition shifting. Multilateralism metrics weakened most. Smaller, flexible arrangements improving in data flows, services trade.

new_signals.title: Emotional Fitness Practices Evolve Beyond Journaling Apps
new_signals.description: Mental wellness evolving beyond journaling apps. Emotional fitness with micro-therapy, mood-mapping, cognitive resilience training. Wellness studios offering 'emotional gyms' with somatic sessions, breathwork circuits.

new_signals.title: Vagus Nerve Stimulation Emerges as 2026 Wellness Protagonist
new_signals.description: Vagus nerve is 2026 wellness protagonist - communication highway between brain and body dictating calm vs. edgy states. Focus on stimulating vagus nerve to relieve stress, insomnia, digestion issues, chronic pain.

new_signals.title: Return to Ancient Sensory Practices: Sound Baths, Moon Ceremonies
new_signals.description: Resurgence of ancient, sensory-focused practices: sound baths, astrology sessions, moon ceremonies, star bathing. Connection with nature and cosmos while cultivating emotional and spiritual equilibrium.
new_signals.source: Simply The Best Magazine, Health Travel

new_signals.title: Wellness Shift from Hustle Culture to Sustainable Holistic Practices
new_signals.description: 2026 wellness theme: shift from hustle culture and biohacking toward sustainable, holistic practices. Balance over optimization. Focus on balance, mindfulness, restoration, connection vs. perfection and extremes.

new_signals.title: Mindfulness Association January 2026 Calendar: Beginner's Mind Theme
new_signals.description: Mindfulness Association released January 2026 calendar centered on Beginner's Mind theme, inviting approach to familiar experiences with curiosity, openness, freshness. Contemplative practice focus.

new_signals.title: Neuro-Health Therapies and Brain-Training Programs in Wellness Resorts
new_signals.description: Wellness resorts incorporating brain-training programmes, neuro-health therapies, mindfulness workshops designed to enhance cognitive function and emotional resilience. Integration of neuroscience and wellness.

new_signals.title: Georgia Tech: Breakthrough in Photonics-Based Quantum Computing Using Non-Abelian Holonomy
new_signals.description: Georgia Tech researchers proposed a revolutionary method for generating quantum entanglement between photons without requiring quantum measurements, using non-Abelian quantum holonomy geometric structure. Could transform future of quantum computing.
new_signals.notes: Alternative university source to MIT/Stanford, demonstrates non-Abelian geometric approach

new_signals.title: CMU Breakthrough: Spray 3D Concrete Printing for Construction Industry
new_signals.description: Carnegie Mellon University researchers developed breakthrough in spray 3D concrete printing that could transform building construction by cutting material waste and enabling stronger, more complex structures for tomorrow's cities.
new_signals.notes: New source discovered - CMU engineering breakthroughs

new_signals.title: MIT CSAIL-Pegatron Partnership: Five-Year Initiative for Physically Intelligent Robots
new_signals.description: MIT CSAIL and Pegatron announced landmark 5-year partnership (2026-2031) to develop next generation of emotionally and physically intelligent robotic systems, combining advanced mechanical design, tactile sensing, multimodal perception, and AI-driven control.
new_signals.notes: Major industry-academic partnership for physical intelligence

new_signals.title: Princeton: Hydrogel-Based Energy Storage Breakthrough for Sustainable Batteries
new_signals.description: Princeton researchers developed hydrogel-based energy storage system representing breakthrough in sustainable battery technology, with potential applications in renewable energy, transportation and soft robotics industries.
new_signals.notes: Schmidt Transformative Technology Fund recipient

new_signals.title: Yale: In Utero Gene Editing Breakthrough for Cystic Fibrosis Cure
new_signals.description: Yale researchers developed method that has potential to cure cystic fibrosis prior to birth using in utero gene editing via nanoparticles to deliver corrective genetic material to fetus of mice with CF.
new_signals.notes: Breakthrough in prenatal genetic medicine

new_signals.title: Oxford: First-Ever Detection of Solar Carbon-Neutrino Interactions
new_signals.description: Oxford physicists led breakthrough study recording first observation of carbon-neutrino interactions, with findings published in Physical Review Letters opening new frontiers in nuclear and particle physics.
new_signals.notes: Rare interaction detection with implications for fundamental physics

new_signals.title: Oxford: Cell Metabolism 'Handbrake' Discovery Reshapes Cancer Drug Understanding
new_signals.description: Oxford Nuffield Department of Medicine team uncovered previously unknown 'handbrake' mechanism controlling how cells respond to cancer drugs, reshaping global understanding of cell metabolism and drug resistance.
new_signals.source: University of Oxford - Nuffield Department of Medicine
new_signals.notes: Fundamental discovery in cancer treatment mechanisms

new_signals.title: HKU: First Human DNA-Cutting Enzyme That Senses Physical Tension Discovered
new_signals.description: HKU and SZBL scientists discovered first human DNA-cutting enzyme that senses physical tension, described as breakthrough in understanding how cells prevent genetic disorders.
new_signals.notes: First discovery from Asian university - HKU breakthrough

new_signals.title: Loneliness Epidemic Intervention: Tobacco-Style Policy Framework Proposed
new_signals.description: Texas A&M School of Public Health research aligns tobacco reduction strategies with U.S. Surgeon General's advisory on loneliness epidemic. Proposes warning labels on devices, age restrictions for apps, social impact assessments for new projects.
new_signals.source: Texas A&M University School of Public Health
new_signals.notes: Novel policy framework applying tobacco control methods to loneliness

new_signals.title: Care Economy Crisis: $600 Billion Value of Unpaid Caregiving in U.S.
new_signals.description: Research shows unpaid caregiving was worth $600 billion in 2021, triple 1996 estimate. 4.4 million Americans provide both eldercare and childcare. Eldercare costs employers over $30 billion annually in turnover and productivity losses.
new_signals.notes: Massive hidden economic impact of caregiving responsibilities

new_signals.title: Intergenerational Workplace Tension: Millennials and Gen Z to Reach 74% of Global Workforce by 2030
new_signals.description: Broadest generational diversity in workplace history occurring now. Millennials and Gen Z projected to be 74% of global workforce by 2030. Employees with managers 12+ years older report 1.5x more likely to have low productivity.
new_signals.notes: Major workplace demographic shift with productivity implications

new_signals.title: Gen Z Prioritizes Mental and Spiritual Well-Being Over Physical Fitness in 2026
new_signals.description: Gen Z's 2026 priorities shift from gym/fitness to mental clarity, emotional balance and spiritual grounding. Spirituality is fluid and personal, focused on connection to self, nature or energy rather than religion.
new_signals.source: ETV Bharat / A Lotus in the Mud
new_signals.notes: Shift from physical to mental/spiritual wellness priorities

new_signals.title: Education AI Integration Shifts from Pilots to System-Wide Strategy in 2026
new_signals.description: 2026 marks transition from experimental AI adoption to system-wide integration in education. AI shifting from pilot projects to natural part of daily classroom experiences, firmly cemented as essential part of institutional strategy.
new_signals.notes: Major inflection point in educational AI adoption

new_signals.title: AI Workers Save 2 Hours Daily But Only 25% Receive Formal Training
new_signals.description: Workers report saving average 2 hours per day using AI tools, yet only 25% receive formal AI training from employers. Workers with AI expertise command salaries up to 56% higher than peers, more than double premium from year before.
new_signals.notes: Major training gap despite productivity gains

new_signals.title: AI-Driven Labor Automation: 11.7% of Jobs Already Automatable with Current Technology
new_signals.description: November MIT study found 11.7% of jobs could already be automated using AI. 2026 predicted as 'year of agents' as software expands from making humans productive to automating work itself. Jobs with AI exposure see slower job growth, especially among younger workers.
new_signals.notes: Critical threshold for automation impact on employment

new_signals.title: Death Tech Industry Explodes to $126 Billion Market with 926 Companies Globally
new_signals.description: Death tech industry now $126 billion market with 926 companies globally and 159 funded startups. Includes digital afterlife, AI chatbots of deceased, and memorial technology. Eternos charges $5,000 to create comprehensive AI replicas of people before they die.
new_signals.notes: New source discovered - emerging spiritual/tech intersection

new_signals.title: Spiritual Crisis Declared by Sen. Warnock: Policy Problem and Moral Crisis
new_signals.description: Sen. Raphael Warnock declared U.S. is in 'spiritual crisis,' stating when people are hungry, can't get healthcare, or have outcomes determined by ZIP code, 'that's a public policy problem. But it's also a moral crisis.'
new_signals.notes: High-level political figure naming spiritual dimensions of policy

new_signals.title: Gen Z Adopts 'Faith Unbundled' Approach to Spirituality
new_signals.description: 77% of young people claim to be spiritual, with Gen Z constructing faith by combining elements from variety of religious and non-religious sources rather than receiving from single system. Prayer, nature, art, yoga, volunteering all considered spiritual practices equally.
new_signals.notes: New source - Springtide Research Institute specializes in youth religion

new_signals.title: Purpose Economy Emerges: Fulfillment as Most Precious Resource
new_signals.description: Purpose Economy describes fundamental shift where sense of fulfillment is becoming most precious resource. Economic value creation focused on enabling purposeful self-expression through serving needs greater than own, enabling personal growth, and building community.
new_signals.notes: New source - Purpose Economy Institute tracks meaning-driven work trends

new_signals.title: FDA Poised to Approve First Psilocybin Therapy Between Late 2026-2027
new_signals.description: Compass Pathways on track to present New Drug Application for synthetic psilocybin to FDA sometime between late 2026 and 2027. FDA granted breakthrough therapy designations for psilocybin in treatment-resistant depression (2018) and major depressive disorder (2019).
new_signals.notes: Timeline for first psychedelic drug approval

new_signals.title: American Enterprise Institute: 2026 Tech Policy Predictions Focus on AI Regulation Warfare
new_signals.description: AEI predicts 2026 will see political warfare between White House and states over AI governance, while AI companies wage fierce lobbying campaign to crush regulations. Trump administration to promote policies facilitating AI growth including easing restrictions on nuclear power for data centers.
new_signals.notes: New conservative think tank source - alternative perspective to Brookings

new_signals.title: Heritage Foundation: FY 2026 NDAA Prioritizes Defense Industrial Base Rebuilding
new_signals.description: Heritage analysis shows FY 2026 NDAA places high priority on rebuilding defense industrial base for modern great-power competition, with provisions to streamline defense acquisition and $1 billion for Taiwan Security Cooperation Initiative.
new_signals.notes: New conservative policy source providing alternative defense policy analysis

new_signals.title: Syria: New Foreign Minister Leads US-Backed Talks with Israel in January 2026
new_signals.description: Syrian delegation led by Foreign Minister Asaad al-Shaibani held talks with Israel in January 2026, marking significant diplomatic engagement. Syria's new administration rapidly gained international legitimacy with lifting of Caesar sanctions and return to UN.
new_signals.notes: New Middle East source - Daily Sabah provides Turkish/regional perspective

new_signals.title: Africa AI Conference 'AI in Action 2026' Set for Lagos on January 22
new_signals.description: Carbon AI announced AI in Action 2026 conference for January 22, 2026 at Lagos Oriental Hotel, aiming to advance practical, homegrown AI solutions across Africa. Focus on Large Language Models, Agentic AI Frameworks, and Generative AI for Africa's transformation.
new_signals.notes: New African source - Punch Nigeria covering tech innovation

new_signals.title: Nigeria's Digital Economy Projected to Hit $18.3 Billion by 2026
new_signals.description: Nigeria's digital economy revenue projected to reach $18.30 billion by 2026, underscoring growing role of technology, fintech, and AI in driving economic growth. 86% of African business leaders plan to pursue acquisitions in 2026.
new_signals.notes: Significant growth projection for Africa's largest economy

new_signals.title: McKinsey State of Fashion 2026: Tariffs Cited as Number-One Hurdle
new_signals.description: Fashion industry's main agenda in 2026 will be adapting to new environment where trade, consumer behavior, and technology remain in rapid flux. Tariffs cited as number-one hurdle for fashion executives navigating structural change.
new_signals.notes: Major industry report highlighting trade tensions impact

new_signals.title: MIT Technology Review's 10 Breakthrough Technologies 2026 List Published
new_signals.description: MIT Technology Review published annual list of 10 Breakthrough Technologies on January 12, 2026. 2025 list featured generative AI search, cleaner jet fuel, long-acting HIV prevention, and world's largest digital camera for astronomy telescope in Chile.
new_signals.notes: Annual authoritative list of transformative technologies

new_signals.title: Axios Predicts AI as Oil Industry's Next Big Unlock for Efficiency
new_signals.description: Axios identifies AI as emerging as oil industry's next big unlock by boosting reserves and supercharging efficiency. Part of broader trend where nearly 70% of Goldman's investors expect gold prices to rise further by end of 2026.
new_signals.notes: AI enabling more efficient fossil fuel extraction - environmental ambiguity

updates.reason: Stage 2 signal provides updated productivity metrics on generational age gaps in management

updates.title: AI Labor Automation - New Metrics on Automation Capability
updates.reason: Stage 2 signal provides specific MIT study findings with 11.7% automation threshold

updates.title: Spiritual Wellness - Psychedelic Therapy Approval Timeline
updates.reason: Stage 2 provides FDA approval timeline for psilocybin therapy (late 2026-2027)

updates.reason: Stage 2 provides specific regional data on Nigeria's $18.3B digital economy projection
